definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: Smokers needed a higher dose than non-smokers to derive any benefit from Viagra.
sentences.chinese: 烟民比非吸烟人士要服用较多伟哥才有反应。

sentences.english: and those with high levels were considered regular smokers.
sentences.chinese: 尼古丁和可替宁含量高的被视为“老烟民”。

sentences.english: As every day each smoker carries this package in his/her pocket, they carry death.
sentences.chinese: 每天烟民们在口袋里带包烟盒，其实他们也带着死亡。

sentences.english: Besides, careless smokers may cause dangerous fires.
sentences.chinese: 除此而外，粗心的烟民还可能引起火灾。

sentences.english: If you are a smoker, stop smoking.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是个烟民，停止吸烟。

sentences.english: Have smokers become more maligned than pedophiles?
sentences.chinese: 难道烟民比恋童癖者还不堪吗？

sentences.english: The average smoker needs over five thousand cigarettes a year.
sentences.chinese: 普通的烟民一年要吸掉超过5000支烟。

sentences.english: I would like to air views of many smokers who feel that the anti-smoking campaign in Hong Kong has gone a step too far.
sentences.chinese: 我支持那些烟民认为香港禁烟运动搞得太过头的观点。

sentences.english: Over the long term, secondhand smoke also raises the risk of disease in nonsmokers.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，二手烟也增加了非烟民的患病几率。

sentences.english: China is home to more than 300m smokers, and a well-developed culture of social puffing.
sentences.chinese: 中国拥有3亿烟民，吸烟的社会风气十分普遍。

sentences.english: But smokers are, on average, skinnier than nonsmokers.
sentences.chinese: 烟民普遍较非吸烟者消瘦。

sentences.english: The rebranding could help the TTM communicate more efficiently with smokers, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，重塑形象能帮助TTM更有效地与烟民沟通。

definition: to ban smoking/to quit smoking/to prohibit cooking/prohibition on opium (esp. in China from 1729)
to resume smoking (after giving up)/to relapse into smoking or drug abuse
